Buckwheat Galettes
250g buckwheat flour
500ml water
5g coarse salt
1 egg
10ml oil
butter or lard
    Prepare the batter
  1. In a bowl, place the buckwheat flour and 5g of salt in a well in the center.
  2. Gradually pour in the water and oil, stirring vigorously to create a smooth, thick batter.
  3. Add the egg and mix well
  4. Cover the bowl with a cloth or plastic wrap and let the batter rest for 2 hours (or preferably overnight) in the refrigerator.
    5. Cooking the galettes
  5. Melt some butter or lard in a frying pan over a medium heat
  6. Pour a ladleful of batter into the pan and tilt the pan to spread the batter across the entire surface.
  7. Cook each side for about 1 to 2 minutes, until golden.
  8. Flip, top with the filling, allow to cook, fold over the edges and serve.
Notes
  • Video of history and making. Best with transcript translated with ChatGPT
Serving Suggestions
  • Serve with savory fillings such as ham, cheese, or eggs. If using eggs, break up the egg white a bit and thin it out over the galette so it cooks through faster
